'Dr' Trump, Tylenol, and why Americans don't trust the 'science'
description: Tylenol, or to use its generic name paracetamol, was in the news recently when Donald Trump suddenly put on his ‘Doctor’ cap and claimed that acetaminophen, the active ingredient in Tylenol, was causing autism, warned pregnant women to avoid the drug, and said the USFDA would include warnings for its use — much to the chagrin of scientific consensus. The problem, however, is that Americans no longer ‘trust the science’. Much like with the Democrats, Americans have had a very messy break-up with scientific consensus — and some of it is thanks to “Dr” Trump, but also because of the mendacious propaganda that passed itself off as science.

title: 'Two things I got': Trump mocks UN over broken escalator, teleprompter

He criticized the UN's lack of support in his diplomatic efforts to end wars, questioning its purpose and effectiveness. Trump emphasized America's unparalleled position globally, citing its strong economy, borders, military, and international relationships.

description: A controversy erupted at Surat’s New Civil Hospital after staff members were filmed performing an aarti and paying respects to a photograph of Asaram Bapu, a convicted rapist. The incident, which took place at the stem cell building's entrance, led to the removal of a security guard and a Class 1 officer.

title: Ex-NFL star Rudi Johnson dies at 45: Battled CTE and mental health; legacy mourned
description: Rudi Johnson, ex-Cincinnati Bengals running back, passed away at 45. He died earlier this week. The cause of death is unknown. Johnson struggled with mental health and CTE effects. He played for Bengals and Detroit Lions. Johnson played college football at Auburn University. He started the Rudi Johnson Foundation. His death shocked teammates and fans. He helped many people.

Brain-eating amoeba: Kerala reports 80 cases; 21 dead
description: Kerala has reported 80 cases and 21 deaths due to Primary Amoebic Meningoencephalitis (PAM), a rare and fatal brain infection caused by Naegleria fowleri. The state health minister Veena George mentioned that the cause of encephalitis cases is still unknown. However, Kerala has developed testing facilities in all microbiology labs and issued guidelines in 2024 for early detection and treatment.

title: Lottery system out? H-1B selection process may be overhauled; what's the new criteria
description: The Trump administration has proposed H-1B visa modifications, prioritizing higher-skilled, better-compensated workers through a weighted selection process based on wage levels. This shift from a random lottery aims to incentivize better compensation and advanced qualifications.

description: Ahead of the United Nation General Assembly, US Secret Service and NYPD took down a device network. This network operated in the tri-state area. It could cripple telecom systems. description: UP NEET PG counselling 2025: The DGME Uttar Pradesh has debarred 148 candidates from the UP NEET PG counselling 2025 for failing to join or resigning from their MD and MS seats during previous stray vacancy rounds. Candidates who do not complete the admission process face security deposit forfeiture and disqualification for the next session. The counselling schedule and security deposit details will soon be released on the official website for MD, MS, Diploma, DNB, and MDS courses.

Their comments come as Nvidia announces a significant $100 billion investment in OpenAI, highlighting the demand for skilled workers in AI and chipmaking.

title: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon says H-1B visa fee hike came out of the blue
description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon expressed surprise at the sudden H-1B visa fee hike implemented by the Trump administration, emphasizing the visa's importance for global talent mobility within the bank. Dimon highlighted the US as an immigrant nation, advocating for merit-based immigration and indicating that businesses will engage with the government to address concerns arising from the new fee.

title: How a heated argument ended with man slashing wife to death on Bengaluru road
description: In a shocking incident in Bengaluru, K Rekha was fatally stabbed 11 times by her husband, Lohitashwa, in public view near Sunkadakatte bus stand. The brutal attack, witnessed by their 12-year-old daughter, stemmed from ongoing disputes between the couple, who both had previous marriages.

title: Hijack scare: Man punches in code to open cockpit door; 9 detained
WWE-style drama: Erika Kirk slammed at funeral; Cody Rhodes meme goes viral;
description: Charlie Kirk's public memorial at State Farm Stadium became a subject of online debate due to its theatrical elements. Erika Kirk's entrance, featuring WWE-style pyrotechnics, drew mockery and comparisons to professional wrestling. Critics questioned the event's tone, with some even suggesting sinister motives, overshadowing the tributes from prominent conservative figures like JD Vance and Donald Trump speech.

title: H-1B visa fee hike: Elon Musk recalls his journey; Says ‘I’m in America via H-1B’
description: Amidst a significant H-1B visa fee hike causing turmoil in the tech sector, an old post from Elon Musk defending the visa program has resurfaced. Musk previously credited H-1B visas for his success and America's tech dominance, vowing to fiercely protect the system. This resurfacing occurs as Indian professionals face potential layoffs and relocation due to the new fees.
